intro: Kielmeyera juruenensis, commonly known as the Juruenense ceiba, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and tall, straight trunk. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic in shape and have a smooth surface. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
